item.title: Report_day_2 9
item.description:
Report: Day 2-9

This week, I barely got anything done. I had big plans—wanted to make progress on my game, add new mechanics, or at least study Japanese—but none of it happened.

Most of my time went into fixing an issue on my Arch Linux. On boot, I kept getting the error:

“Failed to start Nvidia-Persistenced Daemon.”

This also caused Xorg to break. I tried everything—reinstalling nvidia-utils, nvidia-settings, switching kernels—but nothing worked. The only real fix I found was reinstalling the linux-lts kernel, which turned out to be slightly mismatched in version. After that, everything was back to normal. A small win, but it cost me too much time.

item.title: AI and why it's bad for Programming
item.description: Back in 2018 when i tried programming for the first time…

item.title: About me
item.description:
So, you wanna know more about me? Cool!

Let’s begin!

I’m the kind of person who loves diving into different interests—always curious, always exploring. But when it comes to mastering something… well, let’s just say I tend to jump to the next thing before finishing the last.

As a Linux user (more specifically, Arch Linux!!!), I love programming, especially low-level stuff with C and Assembly. What can I show you? Eh… nothing yet. I start projects with motivation, but finishing them? That’s a different story—I usually get distracted by a new one.
